comments.text: 80 years old, 10+ years post external beam treatment for prostate cancer. Sitting, waiting another 30 seconds, and going again pretty much solved any issues beyond a drop or two.

comments.text: Thank you for doing what you do Dr Malik ❤❤❤❤❤

comments.text: I'm turning 39 in March. Like 2 years I went to the urologist about this issue. Didn't really get a explanation as to why this is happening. They took a urine test and according to them the results came back "normal" and I was told to just sit down when I pee. I see that's one of your first options too but added more options and deeper explanations to possible other reasons why this dripping is happening. I usually just stay in the bathroom longer and make sure the pee all comes out. I should work on relaxing my pelvic floor too.  Thanks for the video doctor
comments.author: @zinbx

comments.text: What I do is apply pressure at the base of my scrotum when I finish peeing. It pushes out any remaining pee so I don't dribble in my underwear

comments.text: THIS so I been with my gf for 5 years she's very neat very tidy and she requested I sit-down to pee because it's easier for her to clean the bathroom BUT I genuinely believe this has caused me to have dribble when I sit up I have to then let the rest out..I believe this is because male human anatomy but she says not all men experience that issue. comments.text: This was very helpful and appropriate for me at this time. I've had an enlarged prostate for some years. But, I almost never need to use the toilet more than once a night. My issue is starting to go and the post-void dribble that's getting worse over time. Yet, I've found sitting on the toilet to urinate isn't completely beneficial to me, because while I can void while sitting, afterward, at times, I can still void a good amount while standing.
comments.author: @IPlayOneOnT.V.
